result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard John Krebs

records.addlTxt: Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 6 pages) commencing 06-22-2022 by Jennifer L. Carter.
Received and Filed: Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress
Received and Filed: Notice of Motion and Motion to Dismiss
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 5 pages) commencing 06-22-2022 by Jennifer L. Carter.

Defendant Richard John Krebs not in court, in custody.  Attorney Craig Robert Johnson in court for Richard John Krebs.  Attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense requests a motion to suppress hearing.  Court ordered Defense to file motion documents by November 4, 2022.  Defense further requests speedy trial.  EXPIRATION of speedy: January 4, 2023.  Court scheduled motion, final pre-trial, and jury trial dates.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Richard John Krebs not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Attorney Craig Robert Johnson in court for Richard John Krebs.  Prosecuting attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defense states that there are discovery issues and is requesting an additional status conference. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.
Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

01:47 PM Defendant Richard John Krebs in court with Attorney Craig Robert Johnson; both appear by video.  Defendant Richard John Krebs in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 03CF4512. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer Zachariah Wilber. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Turnover to Justice Point for level 5 supervision with all previoulsy ordered conditons of bail

Attorney Craig Robert Johnson in court, defendant Richard John Krebs not in court, in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail $1,500.00 cash. Case adjourned for preliminary hearing, Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bail, filed by defense

Defendant Richard John Krebs not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Update from SPD regarding appointment of counsel

Defendant Richard John Krebs not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Richard John Krebs not in court, defendant in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with NAI; RRT; VJK

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Richard John Krebs in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant Richard John Krebs in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Richard John Krebs appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
